SEARCH
Package osteele.processing.SerialRecord

Class SerialRecord

java.lang.Object
osteele.processing.SerialRecord.SerialRecord
public class SerialRecord extends Object
A container for an array of ints, that can send them or receive them from the Serial port as comma-separated values terminated by a newline. (This is the format that is used by the Arduino Serial Plotter.)

  • Field Details

    • serial

      public final processing.serial.Serial serial
      The serial port that this SerialRecord uses for sending or receiving.

    • size

      public int size
      The number of values that this record was initialized to. This is also the size of the `values` array.

    • values

      public int[] values
      The array of values. For a record that is used to send values, values are accumulated into this array, and SerialRecord.send() sends them. For a record that is used to receive values, SerialRecord.read() fills this array, and SerialRecord.values[i] or SerialRecord.get(i) can be used to read the values.

    • fieldNames

      public String[] fieldNames
      An array of field names. If the sender includes field names, e.g. "field1:10,field2:20", then this array stores those names, e.g. the first element will be "field1" and the second element will be "field2".

    • sampleTime

      public int sampleTime
      The time in millis() when the record was received.

  • Constructor Details

    • SerialRecord

      public SerialRecord(processing.core.PApplet app, processing.serial.Serial serial, int size)
      Constructor. Construct a serial record that expects `size` number of values.
      Parameters:
      app - the PApplet (generally this)
      serial - the serial port
      size - the number of values

    • SerialRecord

      public SerialRecord(processing.core.PApplet app, processing.serial.Serial serial)
      Constructor. Construct a serial record that receives any number of values.
      Parameters:
      app - the PApplet (generally this)
      serial - the serial port

    • send

      public void send()
      Send the values in the current record to the serial port.

    • send

      public void send(int[] values)
      Send the values in the array to the serial port.
      Parameters:
      values - An array of values to send.

    • write

      public void write()
      Send the values in the current record to the serial port. This method is a synonym for `send()`.

    • write

      public void write(int[] values)
      Send the values in the current record to the serial port. This method is a synonym for `send()`.

    • receive

      public boolean receive()
      If data is available on the serial port, synchronously read a line from the serial port and store the values in the current record. A synonym for readIfAvailable().
      Returns:
      true if data was available and read.

    • receiveIfAvailable

      public boolean receiveIfAvailable()
      If data is available on the serial port, synchronously read a line from the serial port and store the values in the current record.
      Returns:
      true if data was available and read.

    • read

      public boolean read()
      If data is available on the serial port, synchronously read a line from the serial port and store the values in the current record. A synonym for readIfAvailable(). The first two lines received on the serial port when a sketch is started are generally garbled, and are ignored, if they are received within 100 ms of the instantiation of SerialRecord.
      Returns:
      true if data was available and read.

    • read

      public boolean read(int[] values)
      If data is available on the serial port, synchronously read a line from the serial port and store the values in the current record. A synonym for readIfAvailable().
      Returns:
      true if data was available and read.

    • available

      public int available()
      Return the number of bytes available from the underlying serial connection. The main use of this is to compare this number to 0, to see whether a call to read() and its synonyms will read a new record.
      Returns:
      The number of bytes available to read.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Discard all currently-pending unprocessed incoming serial data.

    • draw

      public void draw(float x, float y)
      Display the most-recently transmitted (TX) and received (RX) values on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the display area
      y - the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the display area

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Display the most-recently transmitted (TX) and received (RX) values at the lower left corner of the canvas.

    • periodicEchoRequest

      public void periodicEchoRequest(int interval)
      Request an echo from the Arduino, if it has been more than interval milliseconds since the last echo that was requested through this means.
      Parameters:
      interval - the interval, in milliseconds, between requests for an echo

    • requestEcho

      public void requestEcho()
      Request an echo from the Arduino. It will send back the last values that it has received.
